title: Getting started with 'ggmapinset'
text: default, geom_sf_inset() creates two copies map layer: one base map inset map. inset transformed clipped, uses underlying aesthetics mapping parameters. want different aesthetics two layers, ’ll need turn copying map_base = "none". parameter set inset parameter provided, inset layer drawn. draw base layer, can use map_inset = "none", inset = NULL, simply use normal geom_sf().
code: ggplot(nc) +   # this is equivalent to the following line:   # geom_sf_inset(fill = "white", map_inset = "none") +   geom_sf(fill = "white") +   geom_sf_inset(aes(fill = AREA), map_base = "none") +   geom_inset_frame() +   coord_sf_inset(inset = configure_inset(     centre = sf::st_centroid(sf::st_geometry(nc)[nc$NAME == "Bladen"]), scale = 1.5,     translation = c(-180, -50), radius = 50, units = "mi"))

title: Getting started with 'ggmapinset'
text: default, inset frame transparent, although often makes sense add solid background inset distinguishable overlapping part base map. aesthetics two parts frame burst lines connecting can controlled separately. Note background filled, need specify base inset maps separate layers frame can slip .
code: ggplot(nc) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = AREA)) +   geom_inset_frame(target.aes = list(fill = "white")) +   geom_sf_inset(aes(fill = AREA), map_base = "none") +   coord_sf_inset(inset = configure_inset(     centre = st_centroid(st_geometry(nc)[nc$NAME == "Yancey"]), scale = 2,     translation = c(100, -120), radius = 50, units = "mi"))

title: Getting started with 'ggmapinset'
text: multiple insets, appropriate inset configuration just needs passed layer separately. ’s probably clearer avoid providing inset coordinate system case. Since inset-aware layers duplicate base inset maps, probably want disable behaviour map_base = "none" avoid multiple identical copies base map.
code: inset1 <- configure_inset(   centre = sf::st_centroid(sf::st_geometry(nc)[nc$NAME == "Bladen"]), scale = 1.5,   translation = c(150, -50), radius = 50, units = "mi") inset2 <- configure_inset(   centre = sf::st_centroid(sf::st_geometry(nc)[nc$NAME == "Orange"]), scale = 3,   translation = c(30, 120), radius = 30, units = "mi")  ggplot(nc) +   # base map   geom_sf_inset() +   # inset 1   geom_sf_inset(map_base = "none", inset = inset1) +   geom_inset_frame(inset = inset1, colour = "red") +   # inset 2   geom_sf_inset(map_base = "none", inset = inset2) +   geom_inset_frame(inset = inset2, colour = "blue")

code: @Manual{,   title = {ggmapinset: Add Inset Panels to Maps},   author = {Carl Suster},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/cidm-ph/ggmapinset, https://cidm-ph.github.io/ggmapinset/}, }

title: Add Inset Panels to Maps
text: Add zoomed inset panels ggplot maps.

title: Add Inset Panels to Maps
text: can install ggmapinset like :
code: # CRAN release install.packages('ggmapinset')  # development version install.packages('ggmapinset', repos = c('https://cidm-ph.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))

title: Add Inset Panels to Maps
text: ggmapinset provides drop-replacements sf-related layers ggplot2: replacements work normal versions copy, zoom, clip layers make inset work. stats can used add inset support geoms third-party packages. extension developers, tools provided make sf-based layers inset-aware (see {ggautomap} examples).

title: Add Inset Panels to Maps
text: example adds inset first example ggplot2::geom_sf(). inset area defined circle centred named county, radius 50 miles. inset enlarged factor 2 shifted empty part map.  information, see online documentation vignette("ggmapinset").
code: library(ggmapinset) library(ggplot2)  # load the North Carolina map example shipped with sf nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE)  # find the centroid of the specified county inset_centre <- sf::st_centroid(sf::st_geometry(nc)[nc$NAME == "Yancey"])  # pick some counties to label labelled_counties <- sample(nc$NAME, 10)  # the basic ggplot example: base_plot <- ggplot(nc) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = AREA)) +   geom_sf_label(aes(label = NAME), data = ~dplyr::filter(.x, NAME %in% labelled_counties)) +   coord_sf()  # the same plot with an inset zooming in on one area: ggplot(nc) +   # replace sf layers with their `_inset` versions   geom_sf_inset(aes(fill = AREA)) +   # add the inset frame (the two circles with the connecting lines)   geom_inset_frame() +   geom_sf_label_inset(aes(label = NAME), data = ~dplyr::filter(.x, NAME %in% labelled_counties)) +   # configure the inset in the coordinate system so that all layers can see it   coord_sf_inset(inset = configure_inset(centre = inset_centre, scale = 2, units = "mi",                                          translation = c(70, -180), radius = 50))

what: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
text: plotting, use geom_sf_inset() instead. helper intended used implementing custom geometries based geom_sf_inset() can provide parameters control inset.

title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
code: build_sf_inset_layers(   data,   mapping,   stat,   position,   show.legend,   inherit.aes,   params,   inset,   map_base = "normal",   map_inset = "auto" )

title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
text: data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. stat statistical transformation use data layer, either ggproto Geom subclass string naming stat stripped stat_ prefix (e.g. "count" rather "stat_count") position Position adjustment, either string naming adjustment (e.g. "jitter" use position_jitter), result call position adjustment function. Use latter need change settings adjustment. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders(). params Additional parameters geom stat. inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset(). NA (default), inherited coord (see coord_sf_inset()). map_base Controls layer base map. Possible values "normal" create layer though inset specified, "clip" create layer inset viewport cut , "none" prevent insertion layer base map. map_inset Controls layer inset map. Possible values "auto" choose behaviour based whether inset specified, "normal" create layer viewport cut transformed, "none" prevent insertion layer viewport map.

title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
text: ggplot layer, pair layers.

title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
code: my_custom_geom <- function(mapping = ggplot2::aes(),                            data = NULL,                            stat = "my_custom_stat",                            position = "identity",                            ...,                            inset = NA,                            map_base = "normal",                            map_inset = "auto",                            na.rm = TRUE,                            inherit.aes = TRUE) {   params <- rlang::list2(na.rm = na.rm, ...)   build_sf_inset_layers(data = data, mapping = mapping,                         stat = stat, position = position,                         show.legend = show.legend,                         inherit.aes = inherit.aes,                         params = params,                         inset = inset,                         map_base = map_base,                         map_inset = map_inset) }

what: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
text: configuration returned function normally passed coordinate system via coord_sf_inset(). Currently circular insets supported, one inset per plot.

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
code: configure_inset(   centre,   scale = NULL,   translation = NULL,   radius = NULL,   units = "km",   crs_working = NULL )

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
text: centre Coordinates inset centre. Ideally sfc object (see sf::st_sfc()) including coordinate reference system. sf::st_point() vector longitude latitude also accepted. CRS determined, crs_working assumed. scale Zoom scale: values larger one make circle bigger. translation Translation (shift) inset relative centre. can st_point simply vector length 2 containing x y offsets respectively. Units specified crs_working. radius Radius inset circle units crs_working. units Base length unit (e.g. "km" "mi"). Ignored crs_working provided. See Details supported values. crs_working coordinate reference system use internally applying transformations. See Details.

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
text: inset configuration object class inset_config.

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
text: default crs_working uses equidistant cylindrical coordinate reference system latitude true scale set match latitude centre. ensures circle appear circular cases since projection distorted near centre. geometries converted CRS inset transformation constructing inset frame, converted back CRS centre end. default units kilometres can changed units instead specifying whole projection. possible values units understood proj: "mm": millimetre "cm": centimetre "m": metre "ft": foot "us-ft": US survey foot "fath": fathom "kmi": nautical mile "us-ch": US survey chain "us-mi": US survey mile "km": kilometre "ind-ft": Indian foot (1937) "ind-yd": Indian yard (1937) "mi": Statute mile "yd": yard "ch": chain "link": link "dm": decimeter "": inch "ind-ch": Indian chain "us-": US survey inch "us-yd": US survey yard

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
code: library(sf)  # circular inset with a 2x enlargement cfg <- configure_inset(   centre = st_sfc(st_point(c(-82, 35)), crs = 4326),   scale = 2,   translation = c(70, -180),   radius = 50,   units = "mi")

what: Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
title: Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
text: allows default inset configuration provided avoid repeat layer. layer inset-aware can use default configuration none specifically provided layer. coord also expands axis limits include inset area.

title: Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
code: coord_sf_inset(inset, ...)

title: Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
text: inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset(). ... Arguments passed ggplot2::coord_sf()

title: Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
text: ggplot coordinate object added plot.

title: Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
code: library(ggplot2)  nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE)  ggplot(nc) +   geom_sf_inset(aes(fill = AREA)) +   geom_inset_frame() +   coord_sf_inset(inset = configure_inset(     centre = sf::st_sfc(sf::st_point(c(-80, 35.5)), crs = 4326),     scale = 1.5, translation = c(-50, -140), radius = 50, units = "mi"))

what: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset — geom_inset_frame
title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset — geom_inset_frame
text: Add frame burst lines inset

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset — geom_inset_frame
code: geom_inset_frame(   mapping = ggplot2::aes(),   data = NULL,   stat = "sf_inset",   position = "identity",   ...,   inset = NA,   na.rm = FALSE,   source.aes = list(),   target.aes = list(),   lines.aes = list(),   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = FALSE )

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset — geom_inset_frame
text: mapping, data, stat, position, na.rm, show.legend, inherit.aes, ... See ggplot2::geom_sf(). inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset(). NA (default), inherited coord (see coord_sf_inset()). source.aes, target.aes, lines.aes Override aesthetics inset source, target, lines respectively. value list named aesthetics, values scalars length one.

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset — geom_inset_frame
text: ggplot layer holding inset frame.

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset — geom_inset_frame
text: frame drawn without another sf layer contains data due limitation ggplot layout evaluation. Attempting plot frame result error: "Scale limits mapped onto spatial coordinates coord_sf()".

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset — geom_inset_frame
code: library(ggplot2)  nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE)  ggplot(nc) +   geom_sf_inset() +   geom_inset_frame() +   coord_sf_inset(inset = configure_inset(     centre = sf::st_sfc(sf::st_point(c(-82, 35)), crs = 4326),     scale = 2, translation = c(0, -300), radius = 50, units = "mi"))

what: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
text: geoms wrappers around ggplot2::geom_sf() relatives assist creating map insets. many cases needed use coord_sf_inset() configure_inset() configure location transformation inset, replace sf-related geoms _inset counterparts. Use geom_inset_frame() add frame around inset connects main map.

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
code: geom_sf_inset(   mapping = ggplot2::aes(),   data = NULL,   stat = "sf_inset",   position = "identity",   ...,   inset = NA,   map_base = "normal",   map_inset = "auto",   na.rm = TRUE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )  geom_sf_text_inset(   mapping = aes(),   data = NULL,   stat = "sf_coordinates_inset",   position = "identity",   ...,   where = "inset",   parse = FALSE,   check_overlap = FALSE,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   fun.geometry = NULL )  geom_sf_label_inset(   mapping = aes(),   data = NULL,   stat = "sf_coordinates_inset",   position = "identity",   ...,   where = "inset",   parse = FALSE,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   fun.geometry = NULL )  stat_sf_inset(   mapping = ggplot2::aes(),   data = NULL,   geom = "sf_inset",   position = "identity",   ...,   inset = NA,   na.rm = TRUE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
text: mapping, data, stat, geom, position, na.rm, show.legend, inherit.aes, ... See ggplot2::geom_sf(). inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset(). NA (default), inherited coord (see coord_sf_inset()). map_base Controls layer base map. Possible values "normal" create layer though inset specified, "clip" create layer inset viewport cut , "none" prevent insertion layer base map. map_inset Controls layer inset map. Possible values "auto" choose behaviour based whether inset specified, "normal" create layer viewport cut transformed, "none" prevent insertion layer viewport map. Specifies text position interacts inset. "inset" means points inset area drawn inset map, "base" puts base map. setting merely shorthand setting position aesthetics after_stat(x_inset) after_stat(x) respectively, effect specified mapping. parse TRUE, labels parsed expressions displayed described ?plotmath. check_overlap TRUE, text overlaps previous text layer plotted. check_overlap happens draw time order data. Therefore data arranged label column calling geom_text(). Note argument supported geom_label(). fun.geometry function takes sfc object returns sfc_POINT length input. NULL, function(x) sf::st_point_on_surface(sf::st_zm(x)) used. Note function may warn incorrectness result data projected, can ignore except really care exact locations.

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
text: ggplot layer similar ggplot2::geom_sf() transformed according inset configuration.

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
text: Internally works creating two layers: one base map, one inset. can separately controlled map_base map_inset parameters. inset specified, geom instead behave like ggplot2::geom_sf(). inset configured, default creates base inset layers using aesthetic mapping params:   can alternatively specify two layers separately:   stat_sf_inset() works ggplot2::stat_sf() except also expands axis limits account inset area.
code: geom_sf_inset(...) # draw the base map only (both versions are equivalent): geom_sf(...) geom_sf_inset(..., map_inset = "none")  # separately, draw the inset map only: geom_sf_inset(..., map_base = "none")

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
code: library(ggplot2)  nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE)  ggplot(nc) +   geom_sf_inset(aes(fill = AREA)) +   geom_inset_frame() +   coord_sf_inset(inset = configure_inset(     centre = sf::st_sfc(sf::st_point(c(-80, 35.5)), crs = sf::st_crs(nc)),     scale = 1.5, translation = c(-50, -140), radius = 50, units = "mi"))

what: Get the inset configuration from the params or coord — get_inset_config
title: Get the inset configuration from the params or coord — get_inset_config
text: helper implementing inset-aware ggplot layers. inset missing (NA) default inset configuration retrieved coord.

title: Get the inset configuration from the params or coord — get_inset_config
code: get_inset_config(inset, coord)

title: Get the inset configuration from the params or coord — get_inset_config
text: inset Inset passed param layer coord Coord object plot

title: Get the inset configuration from the params or coord — get_inset_config
text: Inset configuration NULL

title: Get the inset configuration from the params or coord — get_inset_config
code: # defining a new geom deriving from geom_sf() GeomCustom <- ggplot2::ggproto("GeomCustom", ggplot2::GeomSf,   draw_panel = function(self, data, panel_params, coord, inset = NA) {     inset <- get_inset_config(inset, coord)      # do something with the inset ...      # note that this example doesn't pass on the remaining geom_sf params but     # in real usage you would probably want to do that     ggplot2::ggproto_parent(ggplot2::GeomSf, self)$draw_panel(data, panel_params, coord)   }, )

text: Reduce spatial data coordinates way stat_sf_coordinates(). result can used geom_sf() geom_sf_inset() geom needs x y aesthetics.

title: Extract coordinates from 'sf' objects (inset-aware) — stat_sf_coordinates_inset
code: stat_sf_coordinates_inset(   mapping = ggplot2::aes(),   data = NULL,   geom = "point",   position = "identity",   ...,   inset = NA,   fun.geometry = NULL,   where = "inset",   na.rm = TRUE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Extract coordinates from 'sf' objects (inset-aware) — stat_sf_coordinates_inset
text: mapping, data, geom, position, na.rm, show.legend, inherit.aes, ... See ggplot2::stat_sf_coordinates(). inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset(). NA (default), inherited coord (see coord_sf_inset()). fun.geometry function takes sfc object returns sfc_POINT length input. NULL, function(x) sf::st_point_on_surface(sf::st_zm(x)) used. Note function may warn incorrectness result data projected, can ignore except really care exact locations. Specifies text position interacts inset. "inset" means points inset area drawn inset map, "base" puts base map. setting merely shorthand setting position aesthetics after_stat(x_inset) after_stat(x) respectively, effect specified mapping.

title: Extract coordinates from 'sf' objects (inset-aware) — stat_sf_coordinates_inset
text: plot layer

title: Extract coordinates from 'sf' objects (inset-aware) — stat_sf_coordinates_inset
text: geometry sf geometry column containing spatial features

title: Extract coordinates from 'sf' objects (inset-aware) — stat_sf_coordinates_inset
text: x X dimension simple feature y Y dimension simple feature x_inset X dimension simple feature inset transformation y_inset Y dimension simple feature inset transformation inside_inset logical indicating points inside inset viewport inset_scale 1 points outside inset, otherwise configured inset scale parameter

title: Extract coordinates from 'sf' objects (inset-aware) — stat_sf_coordinates_inset
code: library(ggplot2)  nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE)  ggplot(nc) +   geom_sf_inset() +   geom_inset_frame() +   geom_sf_text(aes(x = after_stat(x_inset), y = after_stat(y_inset), label = NAME),     stat = "sf_coordinates_inset") +   coord_sf_inset(inset = configure_inset(     centre = sf::st_sfc(sf::st_point(c(-80, 35.5)), crs = 4326),     scale = 1.5, translation = c(-50, -140), radius = 50, units = "mi"))

title: Transform coordinates according to inset configuration — transform_to_inset
ggmapinset 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-28 Replaced confusing inset_clip inset_copy parameters geom_sf_inset() new map_base map_inset parameters. Inset frame aesthetics can now specified consistently. default inset configuration can passed coord_sf_inset() avoid repeating every layer. Insets now based stat_sf_inset() correctly adjusts coordinate limits computes inset-related variables downstream use. new stat_sf_coordinates_inset(), stat_sf_text_inset(), stat_sf_label_inset() labels complete coverage sf-related layers. Added transform_to_inset() helper applying inset transformation arbitrary geometries (extension developers).

title: ggmapinset 0.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-02-21 Initial CRAN release.
